text:
<@U2LV4CC6B> Yea I've seen a similar example like that one. And these examples work. However, this only seems to work if you specify the first key column. What I want to do is that when a table has two key columns, I want to use the getRows only specifying a value for the second key column, and this is something I can't get to work. 

We also looked at the code of the getRows function and checked how it worked, and we think that the function is not capable of what we want to achieve.
Where would I go to find the docs for these: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/tree/v0.6/membersrvc/ca> ?

<@U37GEHJSV>: you are correct.  You can only use getRows using the keys in order.  So if you have three keys (k1, k2, k3), you can query on k1 or k1,k2 or k1,k2,k3, but you cannot query on k1,k3 or k2,k3 or k2 or k3.
in the case of querying on k1,k2,k3 your would use getRow though.
I haven’t tried getRows specifying all the keys
Quick Question: Any proper way to remove deployed chaincodes (their docker container as way). They consumed many disk space.
